bug.author: netskink
bug.summary: TF2.0 DocSprint Prep - Error with Dataset Example
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/data/Dataset>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/data/Dataset</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The Example for "from_generator" fails. <denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
This example uses tf.enable_eager_execution() which gives the following error AttributeError: module 'tensorflow' has no attribute 'enable_eager_execution' If you remove this line of code the example runs but identifies this code is deprecated in TF V2. <denchmark-h:h3>Correct links</denchmark-h>
I do not see a link to the source. <denchmark-h:h3>Parameters defined</denchmark-h>
The parameters are defined but the example only uses three of the four parameters. The last parameter is optional but not shown how to be used. <denchmark-h:h3>Returns defined</denchmark-h>
The return code is defined correctly as a dataset. <denchmark-h:h3>Raises listed and defined</denchmark-h>
Are the errors defined? For example, <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/feature_column/categorical_column_with_vocabulary_file#raises>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/feature_column/categorical_column_with_vocabulary_file#raises</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Usage example</denchmark-h>
There is a usage example. This PR is regarding the example. <denchmark-h:h3>Request visuals, if applicable</denchmark-h>
There are not example. <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/28842>#28842</denchmark-link>
Are you planning to also submit a pull request to fix the issue? See the docs contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link> and the docs style guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_style>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_style</denchmark-link>
yes <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/28842>#28842</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/netskink>@netskink</denchmark-link> : Thank you for bringing this out and raising PR. Eager execution is enabled by default in TF2.0
You are welcome achandraa. Yesterday there was discussion regarding the branches. Is 2.0 updates going into master branch or r2.0 branch?
Yes you are right. The updates for 2.0 are going to r2.0 branch as of now.
